Package me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder.fieldMapping

Class MapApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder.fieldMapping.MapApi
  • public class MapApi
extends java.lang.Object
    A public-facing interface for accessing the field mapping system.
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Field Detail

      • map

        public Map map
        The map which is used.

        There are a few preset maps contained in this library, but you might want to end up making your own anyways - who knows.

      • robot

        TwoDimensionalRobot robot
        The geometric representation of the robot.

        TwoDimensionalRobot is updatable, meaning the position of it can (and likely does) constantly change.

      • positionWithPriorities

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.ArrayList<Zone>> positionWithPriorities
        A map of positions with the priorities they have.

      • odometry

        Odometry odometry
        Reference to the odometry.

      • mappingName

        private final java.lang.String mappingName
        The name for the asynchronous event.

        Strings are immutable, so we store this here.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapApi

        public MapApi​(Map map)
        Create a new MapApi instance using a map.
        Parameters:
        map - the field map to use. If in doubt, you can use UltimateGoal, SkyStone, or any of the testing maps. Honestly, it doesn't matter in the slightest - it just has to be a map.

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleAsync

        public void scheduleAsync​(Odometry odometry,
                          int duration)
        Schedule an asynchronous updater to automagically update the position of the robot's odometry subsystem for us.
        Parameters:
        odometry - the instance of odometry to use.
        duration - how long in between updates.

      • cancelAsync

        public void cancelAsync()
        Cancel an already-scheduled asynchronous event.

      • importMap

        public void importMap​(Map map)
        Import a map to use.

        This should probably be used exclusively in the constructor of this class, as you can't do much with map importation after everything has already been set up.

        Parameters:
        map - the map to import.

      • update

        public void update​(HeadingCoordinate<java.lang.Double> pose2d)
        Update the whole map system.

        This will probably end up being done automatically, so you likely don't have to worry about manually updating it.

        Parameters:
        pose2d - the position of the robot

      • getPositionsString

        public java.lang.String getPositionsString()
        Get the list of zones the robot is in as a string.

        The string is ordered by zone priority. Keep in mind higher priorities override lower ones.

        Returns:
        the list of zones the robot is in.
